title: Cristom 2016 Mount Jefferson Cuvée Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Cristom's multivineyard blend is a polished effort that overdelivers for the price. Spicy and pungently herbal aromas lead into flavors of tart strawberry and peppery herb. The leaf and bark aspect is forceful but nicely integrated, and the structure suggests aging this a few years for optimal drinking.

title: Damiani 2016 Barrel Fermented Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)
description: An opulent nose of ripe yellow apple and melon melds with highlights of rose, ginger and white pepper spice. The palate is rich and silken in feel yet impeccably balanced by supportive acidity and delicate astringency. Succulent flavors of melon and canned peach meet with flecks of spice and flowers to give an overall broad impression.

title: Domaine Dozon 2017  Chinon
description: This rich wine is structured and firm while also having red berry and cherry fruits, rich smoky flavors and final acidity. Its tannins and tight acidity also promise aging. Drink this wine from 2021.

title: Domaine Jean-Paul Balland 2017  Sancerre
description: This wine has a good balance between rich apple flavors and tight acidity and minerality, reveling in the warm 2017 vintage. The texture is taut, but the young wine will soften in a few months to offer smoothness and roundness. Drink from 2019.

title: Duck Pond 2016 Hylo Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: The winery's lineup of single vineyard Pinots features sites rarely if ever seen elsewhere, but all are deserving of extra attention. The high elevation (aptly named) Hylo Vineyard selection is all Pommard clone, with generous raspberry and cherry lollipop fruit. The natural-tasting acids bring citrus and tangerine, and the finish is focused and long.

title: Elias Mora 2015  Toro
description: Savory, meaty berry aromas are unconventional and gamy more than bold, oaky and fruity. A plump round palate is full but not fat, while roasted meaty blackberry flavors finish toasty and snappy, with touches of heat and burn that should slip away with more time in bottle; drink through 2025.

title: Elio Filippino 2013 San Cristoforo  (Barbaresco)
description: Red berry, underbrush and tobacco aromas lead the nose. The savory palate offers red cherry, cinnamon and star anise alongside fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2021–2029.

title: Fess Parker 2016 Pommard Clone Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Very earthy on the front end, this clonal selection presents aromas of dark hibiscus, baked red fruits, pine forest floor, peppercorn and wild herbs. Tangy cranberry and sour cherry show on the sip, where a decent tension frames the palate.

title: Fournier Père et Fils 2015 Grande Cuvée  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: The extra richness of a Pouilly Fumé is very apparent in this wine. Its ripe white fruits are tense, tangy while also full bodied and, even after three years, still very young. That bold fruitiness needs to soften further, so drink from 2019.

title: Gyéjacquot Frères NV Anatom Noir Extra Brut  (Champagne)
description: This wine is rich and full in the mouth, with some good mature flavors. The creamed apple has garnered a nutty, toasty character that gives it ripe complexity. Textured and very complete, this bottling is ready to drink.

title: Henri Bourgeois 2016 La Bourgeoise  (Sancerre)
description: Intense, fruity and now ready to drink, this wine comes from some of the old parcels of the Bourgeois estate. It is rich while remaining crisp, with a flinty edge that gives it a good texture.

title: Kessler-Haak 2014 Estate Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Fresh and lively aromas of hibiscus, sumac and tea leaves make for a compelling entry to this bottling. Tart cherry and plum-skin flavors lead into richer fruit toward the finish, with touches of Earl Grey tea and loamy soil throughout.

title: Lanson NV Green Label Brut  (Champagne)
description: Made from organically grown grapes (hence Green Label), this wine is very much in the crisp Lanson style. The rich character is tensely textured, full of tight minerality as well as green fruits and wonderful final acidity. Drink this bottling now.

title: Lingua Franca 2016 The Plow Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: Firmly rooted in flavors of blueberries and plums, this adds accents of black olive and green tea. The tannins are substantial and somewhat astringent, with a finishing touch of orange peel.

title: MacMurray Estate Vineyards 2016 Winemaker's Block Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Softly alluring and youthfully vibrant in fresh power and tart acidity, this block-designate is spicy and fruit-forward in black cherry, blackberry and a dip of vanilla cola.

title: Merry Edwards 2016 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Herbal and forested in savory elements like rose petal and black tea, this is a gorgeously rich and round red wine, a true showcase of the appellation and sure to please a crowd. Red and black cherry are met by wild strawberry and lush waves of depth.

title: Navarro 2016 Premiere Reserve Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)
description: This is a beautiful, elegant, lighter-styled wine in a half-bottle that shows great balance between ripeness and fresh acidity. Lemon and crisp apple aromas lead to light vanilla and butter flavors that mingle well with the fruit elements.

title: Oso Libre 2013 Carnal Red (Paso Robles)
description: This blend of 64% Grenache, 22% Mourvèdre and 14% Syrah certainly plays toward the riper end of the spectrum, but its roasted red fruit is deeply layered with star anise, ginger, clove and caramel aromas. It's powerful on the palate, with unctuous flavors of roasted blackberry and plum as well as more baking spice.

title: Planeta 2016 Dorilli  (Cerasuolo di Vittoria Classico)
description: Made with 70% Nero d'Avola and 30% Frappato, this opens with aromas of dark berry, underbrush and a whiff of carob. The polished, balanced palate offers blackberry jam, Marasca cherry and white pepper alongside fine-grained tannins. An orange zest note signals the close.

title: Prinz Salm 2016 Dalberger Ritterhölle Erste Lage Trocken Riesling (Nahe)
description: Spicy, earthen aromas juxtapose crisp white grapefruit and lemon in this dry, medium-bodied wine. It's a zesty, intensely mineral wine backed by piercing shards of lemon-lime acidity. Still in its youth, it's a tightly wound wine that should yield and expand from 2021 to 2030.
